The 'Sipuncula' or 'Sipunculida' (common names 'sipunculid worms' or 'peanut
worms') is a group containing 144-320 species (estimates vary) of bilaterally
symmetrical, unsegmented marine worms. Traditionally considered a phylum,
molecular work suggests that they might be a subgroup of phylum Annelida.
